intro: Kyrstenia occidentalis, commonly known as the western kyrstenia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and native plant landscaping.
